string.text: Unlock with the Cultural Pride doctrine.
Acquire a fief to unlock clan troops.
For each skill, have at least one custom troop with a level of 150 or higher.
In a single battle, get a kill using five different weapons classes.
XP is refunded when lowering a troop's skill.
Disabled: no XP costs set by config.
Disabled: XP refunds already enabled by config.
Win a battle against over 100 enemies using a party evenly split among infantry, cavalry and ranged clan troops
Win a 150+ battle while outnumbered and fielding only custom troops of your own culture.
Capture a fief of your own culture from an enemy kingdom.
Unlocks all items of clan and kingdom cultures.
Disabled: all equipment already unlocked by config.
Disabled: culture items already unlocked by config.
Win a tournament in a town of your own culture.
An error occurred while updating this troop's appearance. The previous appearance has been restored. See log for details.
This combination of gender and culture is not supported.
This combination of gender, culture and species is not supported.
No battle data available yet for this troop.
Can unlock items from allied party kills.
Disabled: all equipment already unlocked by config.
Disabled: unlocks from kills disabled by config.
Lead an army of mostly allied troops to victory against an enemy army.
Turn the tide of a battle involving an allied army.
Save 3 caravans or villager parties from enemy attacks.
Maintain a retinue-only party's morale above 90 for 15 days.
Are you sure you want to buy {NAME} for {COST} gold?
Cannot exceed skill level of upgrade {CHILD}.
Troops that have upgrade targets cannot be removed.
out of fifteen troops, one will spawn as captain.
Enable or disable this set for civilian use.
You must keep at least one civilian set.
You must keep at least one battle set.
The first set must remain a battle set.
Acquire a new fief for your clan.
Win a battle in which you and your companions get 50 or more kills.
Own a smithy in a town of your clan's culture for 30 days.
This will replace existing troop definitions.
You do not have enough gold to hire these retinues.
You do not have enough influence to hire these retinues.
Copy this equipment set to the clipboard.
Cannot create equipment sets for heroes.
Do you want to copy the current set or create an empty set?
Defeat a ruler of a different culture in battle.
Disabled: special troops unlocked from config.
Get 100 kills in battle with troops wearing no foreign gear.
Win a tournament wearing only armor of your own culture.

Your {FACTION}'s custom troops are now unlocked.{newline}{newline}Would you like to clone the entire {CULTURE} troop tree, or would you prefer building them from scratch?{newline}{newline}Copying your culture's troops will provide you with good gear and good troops. Starting from scratch is the more difficult choice.{newline}{newline}This decision is irreversible.
Disable Captain Mode for this troop.
Heroes are tied to the saved world state.
This will open the Retinues documentation in your default web browser.{newline}{newline}Continue?
Enable Captain Mode for this troop.
Enter the name of the new troop:
This is a pending item change.{newline}{newline}To apply the change, select 'Equip troops' from a fief's town menu.
The following troops have equipped new items:{newline}{newline}{SUMMARY}
The equipment list has been truncated to show only the first {MAX_ROWS} items. Refine your filters or search to see more specific results.
Skill is required for equipped items.
If enabled, troops spawning with this equipment set will be of the opposite gender.
Open the global editor for all factions.
Open the full appearance editor for this hero.
At least one battle set must remain enabled for each battle type.
Have 100 retinue troops survive being struck down in battle.
Have your retinue defeat 200 enemies in a single battle.
Win by yourself against 100+ enemies without a single death on your side.

Some culture troop trees in this campaign were edited after this export was created.{newline}{newline}To restore the world state as it was when this file was exported, first use 'Reset All' in the global editor, restart the game, then import again.
Select an exported file to import.
Have your retinues defeat 25 enemy troops of equivalent tier without a single casualty.
Fight a siege battle as a defender with at least 20 retinue troops and win.
Win 3 defensive battles in a row with a retinue-only party.
Defeat a party twice your size using only custom troops.
Lead an army for 10 days in a row.
Upgrade 100 basic custom troops to max tier.
Win a 100+ battle, while outnumbered, and fielding only custom troops of tier 1, 2, or 3.
Have 12 custom troops reach 90 in Athletics skill.
No tier restriction for arms and armor.
Get 100 kills in battle with troops wearing a tier 6 armor and helmet.
New gear unlocked: {ITEMS}, and {MORE} more items.
Personally defeat 25 enemies in one battle.
Personally defeat 5 tier 5+ troops in one battle.
Hero kills count twice for unlocks.
Disabled: all equipment already unlocked by config.
Disabled: unlocks from kills disabled by config.
Personally defeat an enemy lord in battle.
Lowering this troop's skill will not refund any experience points. Continue anyway?
Extra upgrade branch for elite troops.
Disabled: elite upgrades already maxed in config.
Knock out 50 opponents in the arena.
Upgrade 100 elite troops to max tier.
Troop has reached maximum amount of upgrades.
Will purge of all Retinues custom troop data in the current save so the mod can be uninstalled safely.
Player clan and kingdom culture items are always available.
Any lord can recruit custom troops in the player's fiefs.
Any lord can recruit custom troops in the player's fiefs (required for Improved Garrisons compatibility).
Maximum allowed difference between troop tier and item tier.
Clan Volunteers In Kingdom Fiefs Proportion
Chance for each volunteer in the player kingdom's fiefs to be a clan troop (0 = never, 1 = always). Set a higher value if you want to mix clan troops with kingdom troops.
When unlocking a new troop, copy all equipment sets from the original troop instead of only the main battle and civilian sets.
Chance for each vanilla volunteer to be replaced by a custom troop (0 = never, 1 = always). Set a lower value if you want to keep some vanilla volunteers in your settlements.
The custom kingdom troop tree will be disabled and clan troops will be used instead.
Enables the Doctrines system and its bonuses. Warning: saving with doctrines disabled will clear all doctrine data in the save.
Enables the hotkey (Shift + R) to open the editor from the campaign map.
Enables feat requirements for unlocking doctrines. Warning: saving with this disabled will clear all feat data in the save.
Adds comparison icons to the equipment list to show if an item is better or worse than the equipped one when browsing troop equipment.
Adds appearance customization controls (age, height, weight, build) to the editor. Cosmetic only; no gameplay effect.
Multiplier for equipment prices compared to base game prices.
To apply item changes, troops must spend time upgrading equipment in a fief.
Force Main Battle Set In Combat
Troops always use their main battle equipment set in combat, ignoring alternate sets. Use this setting if you experience issues with troops using incorrect equipment sets in battle.
When lowering a troop's skill, always refund the XP previously spent on those points.
Enables the global troop editor to modify any troop in the game. Disable if you encounter issues with non-player troops or other mods.
Gold cost to convert a troop into a retinue, per tier of the target retinue troop.
Influence cost to convert a troop into a retinue, per tier of the target retinue troop.
Kingdom Volunteers In Clan Fiefs Proportion
Chance for each volunteer in the player clan's fiefs to be a kingdom troop (0 = never, 1 = always). Set a higher value if you want to mix kingdom troops with clan troops.
Maximum proportion of basic retinues in player party.
Maximum number of upgrade paths each basic troop can have.
Maximum proportion of elite retinues in player party.
Maximum number of upgrade paths each elite troop can have.
When checking mount requirements for upgrades, ignore any horse in civilian sets.
Special troops (militias, villagers, caravan guards) can be acquired without the appropriate doctrines.
Troops can be unlocked without having to own a fief.
Troops never require noble horses for upgrades, a war horse is always enough.
Whether item unlock progression also adds progress to random items of the player culture.
Rank up cost for retinue troops per tier.
How many times an item must be discarded to unlock it.
How many enemies wearing an item must be defeated to unlock it.
Player can only edit troops when in a fief owned by their clan or kingdom (retinues can be edited in any settlement).
Troops equipment can only be purchased if available in the current town inventory.
Custom troops can only be recruited in settlements owned by the player's clan or kingdom.
Volunteers in settlements of a different culture will not be replaced by custom troops.
Additional skill cap for retinue troops.
Additional skill total for retinue troops.
All edited troops share a single XP pool instead of having individual XP.
The maximum skill level for hero troops.
The maximum skill level for tier {TIER} troops.
The total available skill points for tier {TIER} troops.
Base XP cost for increasing a skill.
Scalable XP cost for each additional skill point.
To apply skill increases, troops must spend time training in a fief.
Unlock equipment by defeating enemies wearing it.
Displays a popup notification when items are unlocked. If disabled, unlocks are only shown in the log.
Vanilla troops retain their original upgrade item requirements when edited.
Lords of the player's clan or kingdom can recruit custom troops in their fiefs.
No clans exist for the {CULTURE} culture.
No cultures are loaded in the current game.
No valid export files were found in the Exports folder.
No skill points left for this troop.
This combination of gender and culture does not have a valid model.{newline}{newline}The previous appearance has been restored.
This combination of gender, culture and species does not have a valid model.{newline}{newline}The previous appearance has been restored.
You do not have enough gold to purchase this item.
Not enough XP for next skill point.
You must be in one of your clan's fiefs to {ACTION} this troop.
You must be in one of your kingdom's fiefs to {ACTION} this troop.
Not in a running campaign. Load a save first.
You must be in a settlement to {ACTION} this troop.
Only regular troops can be upgraded.
Cannot go below parent {PARENT}'s skill level.
You need {GOLD} gold to paste this equipment, but you only have {CURRENT}.
Pasting {TROOP}'s equipment n°{INDEX} will cost {GOLD} gold. Continue?
Paste {TROOP}'s equipment n°{INDEX} onto the current set?
Clipboard is empty. Copy an equipment set first.
Paste the copied equipment onto this set.
Some items cannot be equipped by this troop.
A non-civilian item cannot be equipped in a civilian set.
You do not have enough gold.
You lack enough copies of required items.
Open the editor for your clan and kingdom troops.
Win three battles in a row while part of an allied lord's army.
Win a battle in which allies suffer over 100 casualties.
Can unlock items from allied party casualties.
Disabled: all equipment already unlocked by config.
Disabled: unlocks from kills disabled by config.
Rescue a defeated lord from a enemy party's prisoner train.
It will cost you {COST_GOLD} gold and {COST_XP} XP.
You do not have enough gold to rank up {TROOP_NAME}.{newline}{newline}Rank up cost: {COST} gold.
You do not have enough XP to rank up {TROOP_NAME}.{newline}{newline}Rank up cost: {COST} XP.
Max out this retinue's skills before you can rank up.
Cannot remove equipment sets for heroes.
At least one set of this type must remain.
Are you sure you want to permanently remove {TROOP_NAME}?{newline}{newline}Their equipment will be stocked for later use, and existing troops will be converted to their {CULTURE} counterpart.
This will reset all culture troop data to their default values. Player clan and kingdom troops will not be affected.{newline}{newline}Continue?
All culture troops will be reset upon saving and reloading the game.
Retinues will join you for free over time as long as you keep earning renown.{newline}{newline}You can set a hiring limit to control how many retinues can join your party.
The following retinues have joined your party: {JOINED}.
One new retinue per {COST} renown earned.
The hiring limit has been reached.

The Retinues mod version in this save file does not match the current mod version ({CURRENT_VERSION}).{newline}{newline}As a safety precaution, check that everything is as it should before overwriting your save.{newline}{newline}If you notice any issues and wish to go back to the previous version, do not save and download the {SAVE_VERSION} file from Nexus Mods.

The Retinues mod version in this save file does not match the current mod version ({CURRENT_VERSION}).{newline}{newline}As a safety precaution, check that everything is as it should before overwriting your save.{newline}{newline}If you notice any issues and wish to go back to the previous version, do not save and download the version you were previously using from Nexus Mods.

The Retinues mod version in this save file has been updated to the next version ({CURRENT_VERSION}). Your save data has been automatically migrated to the new version.{newline}{newline}As a safety precaution, check that everything is as it should before overwriting your save.{newline}{newline}If you notice any issues and wish to go back to the previous version, do not save and download the {SAVE_VERSION} file from Nexus Mods.

The Retinues mod version in this save file has been updated to the next version ({CURRENT_VERSION}). Your save data has been automatically migrated to the new version.{newline}{newline}As a safety precaution, check that everything is as it should before overwriting your save.{newline}{newline}If you notice any issues and wish to go back to the previous version, do not save and download the version you were previously using from Nexus Mods.
Get 1000 kills with custom kingdom troops.
Have a companion of the same culture as your kingdom govern a kingdom fief for 30 days.
Disabled: special troops unlocked from config.
Unlock with the Royal Patronage doctrine.
Unlock the 'Clan Traditions' doctrine to show crafted items.
Only weapon slots can have crafted items.
Skill is at cap for this troop.
Defend a village from a raid using only custom troops.
Win a siege defense using only custom troops.
Max out the skills of 15 custom troops.
This set has {COUNT} non-civilian item(s). They will be unequipped if you continue.{newline}{newline}Proceed?
The following troops have completed their training:{newline}{newline}{SUMMARY}
Before skill point increases are applied, troops must undergo training.{newline}{newline}This is done by selecting 'Train troops' from a fief's town menu.
View battle statistics for this troop.
Unequipping is instant, but equipping a different item later may take time.{newline}{newline}Confirm?
Revert all staged equipment changes for {TROOP_NAME}?
Choose one or more troops to start equipping now.
Choose one or more troops to start training now.
Clear a hideout using only your retinue.
Disabled: retinue cap already maxed in config.
Have a retinue get the first melee kill in a siege assault.
Win a 100+ battle using only your retinue.
Reveal the secrets of your most precious artifacts and I will let you go.
You have unlocked the secrets of: {ITEMS}.
